DataElement.preferredName: Radionuclide Imaging Agent Radiopharmaceutical Compound Purity Assessment Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The purity of the radionuclide imaging agent test represented as a numerical value.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Procedure Agents Domain Radionuclide Imaging Agent Radiopharmaceutical Compound Purity Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to agents used as part of a procedure._An imaging technique that uses a small dose of a radioactive chemical (isotope) called a tracer that can detect sites of cancer growth, trauma, infection or degenerative disorders. The tracer, which is either injected into a vein or swallowed, travels through the bloodstream to the target organ, and emits gamma rays, which are detected by a gamma camera and analyzed by a computer to form an image of the target organ._An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect._An agent that contains a radioactive isotope and is used for diagnostic or therapeutic purposes._A quantitative assessment of the homogeneity or uniformity of a mixture. Alternatively, purity refers to the degree of being free of contaminants or heterogeneous components._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to agents used as part of a procedure.

Concepts.definition: A domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to agents used as part of a procedure.

Property.preferredName: Radionuclide Imaging Agent Radiopharmaceutical Compound Purity Assessment
Property.preferredDefinition: An imaging technique that uses a small dose of a radioactive chemical (isotope) called a tracer that can detect sites of cancer growth, trauma, infection or degenerative disorders. The tracer, which is either injected into a vein or swallowed, travels through the bloodstream to the target organ, and emits gamma rays, which are detected by a gamma camera and analyzed by a computer to form an image of the target organ.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.:An agent that contains a radioactive isotope and is used for diagnostic or therapeutic purposes.:A quantitative assessment of the homogeneity or uniformity of a mixture. Alternatively, purity refers to the degree of being free of contaminants or heterogeneous components.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: An imaging technique that uses a small dose of a radioactive chemical (isotope) called a tracer that can detect sites of cancer growth, trauma, infection or degenerative disorders. The tracer, which is either injected into a vein or swallowed, travels through the bloodstream to the target organ, and emits gamma rays, which are detected by a gamma camera and analyzed by a computer to form an image of the target organ.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
An agent that contains a radioactive isotope and is used for diagnostic or therapeutic purposes.
A quantitative assessment of the homogeneity or uniformity of a mixture. Alternatively, purity refers to the degree of being free of contaminants or heterogeneous components.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
